assessment_motivation.description: Why they decided to take the TMP assessment
assessment_motivation.example: My manager suggested it for our team restructure

current_challenges.description: What they're currently struggling with at work

initial_expectations.description: What they hoped to learn from the assessment
initial_expectations.example: Understanding why I clash with certain team members

role_resonance_level.description: How well the major role fits their self-perception

role_evidence_examples.description: Specific examples where they've demonstrated their major role
example: Last week I spent hours perfecting our compliance documentation
I always double-check everyone's work before submission

role_surprises.description: What surprised them about their profile
role_surprises.example: I didn't realize how much I value structure until seeing it scored at 9

strongest_preference_example.description: Real situation demonstrating their strongest preference
strongest_preference_example.example: I created a 20-page process manual that no one asked for because I felt we needed standards

preference_conflicts.description: When their preferences clash with work demands
example: Being asked to brainstorm without an agenda drives me crazy
Having to present ideas before they're fully formed

coping_mechanisms.description: How they handle working against preferences

best_working_relationships.description: Who they work well with and why

example.name: Sarah
example.reason: She's also detail-oriented and appreciates structure

challenging_relationships.description: Who they struggle to work with and why

example.name: Tom
example.reason: He always wants to 'wing it' without planning

team_role_perception.description: How they think their team sees them
team_role_perception.example: Probably as the quality police or the one who slows things down with questions

collaboration_patterns.example: I prefer to work alone first, then share completed drafts for feedback

leadership_style_description.description: How they describe their leadership/influence approach
leadership_style_description.example: I lead by example and expect others to maintain the same standards

example: Successfully implemented new quality control system
Mentored junior team member to improve attention to detail

leadership_failures.description: When their leadership approach didn't work
example: Team felt I was micromanaging during product launch
Lost buy-in when I pushed my solution without enough consultation

influence_strategies.description: How they get others on board
influence_strategies.example: I prepare detailed documentation and evidence to support my recommendations

example: I sometimes don't share my thinking until it's complete

blind_spot_reactions.description: Response to potential blind spots surfaced
blind_spot_reactions.example: I hadn't realized that people might feel excluded when I work alone for long periods

past_feedback_alignment.description: How profile aligns with previous feedback received
example: My manager has said I need to be more flexible
360 feedback mentioned I should communicate more during projects

meaningful_work_description.description: What makes work meaningful for them
meaningful_work_description.example: When I can see that my standards and processes protect the team from errors and rework

values_alignment_level.description: How aligned current role is with values (1-10)

values_conflicts.description: When work conflicts with their values
example: Being asked to rush something that compromises quality
Having to support decisions I don't believe in

ideal_communication_style.description: How they prefer others communicate with them
ideal_communication_style.example: Give me time to process, preferably send things in writing first

team_communication_tips.description: Their top 3 tips for team to communicate with them
example: Give me time to think before expecting answers

current_work_alignment.description: Percentage of time in preference areas vs. non-preference

biggest_insight.example: I need to bring my team along during my thinking process, not just at the end

profile_surprises.description: What surprised them about their profile
example: The split wheel pattern explains my internal conflicts
My beliefs score being higher than analytical

connection_moments.description: When things clicked or made sense
example: This explains why I struggle with John's working style
Now I understand why quick decisions stress me out

immediate_experiments.description: What they'll try in the next week
example: Share my draft thoughts in the Monday meeting
Ask for written briefs before meetings
Hold weekly 'thinking out loud' sessions with my team
Manager to help protect focused work time

team_sharing_plan.description: How they'll share insights with their team
team_sharing_plan.example: Present my profile at next team meeting with specific collaboration tips

manager_discussion_points.description: What to discuss with their manager

example: How do I work better with opposite types?

follow_up_timeline.example: In one month after trying changes

key_breakthrough_moment.description: When the biggest shift in understanding occurred
key_breakthrough_moment.example: When we discussed how my need for complete thoughts impacts team inclusion
